prefix: Approach the following question the way someone with a PhD in philosophy would.
problem_prompt:
Approach the following question the way someone with a PhD in philosophy would. A current-carrying cylindrical wire with a radius of 9 cm has a current of 1 A flowing through it. Calculate the magnitude and direction of the magnetic field at a distance of 17 cm from the center of the cylinder. Additionally, please select the option from the given choices that you believe is closest to the correct answer! (Please note that the following content involves constants might be used in the calculations : \mu_0 = 1.26 * 10^(-6) V·s/(A·m)

A. 0.98 x 10^(-5) Tesla
B. 0.12 x 10^(-5) Tesla
C. 0.75 x 10^(-5) Tesla
D. 0.72 x 10^(-5) Tesla

Answer:
